discourse_list.title: [Agenda/Discussion] Collateral Onboarding Call #6 - Wednesday, August 26 17:00 UTC

content.content: Time in your local-timezone format: Wednesday, August 26, 2020 5:00 PM  Dial In Details Zoom Call  Passcode:  314223  Intro Welcome to another of our regularly scheduled bi-weekly collateral onboarding call to discuss potential assets for MCD, open for anyone to join and present.  For questions, discussions and feedback on the call, please check out this thread   If you’d like to present, check out this thread    Agenda Zoom Call  // Passcode:  314223 August 12, 2020 7:00 PM  Intro by @_LS and @spin  Presentation 1: ShuttleOne @shuttlenaut, founder of ShuttleOne will discuss this MIP6 - Collateral Application  Followed by a discussion.  Presentation 2: Arca Labs @blairb will be presenting ArCoin and the MIP 6 - Collateral Application Followed by a discussion.

Collateral Call Summary - Episode #06  August 26th, 2020  Agenda   00:10: Intro with Lea Schmidt  5:10: ShuttleOne with Zhuang Hong Lim  25:00: Q&A and Discussion about ShuttleOne  31:40: ArCoin with Jerald David, Mason & Jeff Dorman  49:50: Q&A and Discussion about ArCoin   Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aG9UU-XPULE  Introduction  Lea Schmidt  Agenda and Preamble 00:10  Open discussion about the selection process for topics on these calls. How to create a system to organize calls in order to be fair with everyone in the community. For this call: project selection based on the activity in the forum. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.    ShuttleOne  Zhuang Hong Lim  Credit Application Token (CAT): Global Supply Chain Financing (ShuttleOne) - Forum Thread In the forum: @shuttlenaut    Presentation 5:10  Cover Slide1814×1018 159 KB   DeFi/Real World assets910×500 91.6 KB   Network908×506 70.6 KB   System Overview912×518 88.3 KB   Product Overview906×507 178 KB   Enabling Payments904×507 142 KB   Decentralized Asset Financing905×501 132 KB   Trade Financing906×506 143 KB   Computer Vision906×502 146 KB   Operational Risk Management903×505 173 KB   Demonstration907×502 118 KB   Demo Result1064×595 192 KB   Credit Scoring: Cover1086×602 110 KB   Credit Scoring: Demo1419×626 333 KB   Credit Scoring: Demo #21402×597 298 KB   Decentralized Finance Disbursement1084×609 174 KB   Cross Border Trade Financing1085×609 160 KB   The Business1083×610 136 KB   Summary1063×599 87.5 KB   The Team1082×607 205 KB   Closing Slide1082×603 106 KB   Discussion  25:00 - Akash: How do you make sure that the bank statement that is produced using computer vision to read is not fraudulent? 25:00 - Akash: Is the collateral in the Maker system a tradable asset and at what point does it have a bad price and needs to be liquidated? 25:00 - Akash: How do the Auction Keepers buy that collateral and how do they value it? 28:50 - Akash: Would there be a tradable market for this collateral tokens? If the value falls, does the MakerDAO system deploys the auction for these collaterals so that some auction vault has to buy it and return Dai to the system?   ArCoin  Jerald David, Jeff Dorman, Mason  [ARCA] ArCoin MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application In the forum: @blairb    Presentation 31:40  Cover1047×807 70.9 KB   Claims - hay una palabra pero no me viene1040×801 443 KB   The Team1044×804 294 KB   Commitment1043×799 342 KB   Treasury Fund1042×802 231 KB   Providers/Partners1046×794 257 KB   Fund Attributes1040×808 286 KB   Reliability1040×805 199 KB   ArCoin Bridge Cover1038×798 69.6 KB   Product Transformation ARC1396×1080 136 KB   Why is ArCoin well suited for Maker?1395×1079 125 KB   ArCoin Keeper Governance1396×1080 229 KB   ArCoin Liquidation Process1041×806 275 KB   ArCoin Liquidity DAO1392×1080 112 KB   ArCoin Disclosures1020×791 140 KB   Discussion  49:50 - Akash: How does the Maker Protocol gets KYCed to accept this as a collateral? 51:10 - Akash: The yielding need to be higher than the DSR to avoid arbitrage opportunities. Does that make sense? 53:25 - Akash: Since ArCoin is a low-yielding product, what would be an acceptable stability fee for most users? What is the upper bound on the stability fee? 56:45 - Akash: If the Keeper ends up buying this ArCoin through an auction/liquidation, what’s the process to redeem and get the treasuries and liquidate that? 57:10 - Akash: Could the same concept be extended to other collateral types besides US treasuries? 1:01:30 - Akash: Can the whole model be extended to other assets like ETFs or other securities that could be bundled up in this form? 1:02:20 - Akash: Anyone in the world can apply for KYC to buy or sell this ArCoin, right?   Closing Comment  Lea Schmidt  Outro 1:03:20  Thanks, everyone for joining. If you want to present your project, please leave a note in this Forum Post.   Credits  Gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

Thanks for organizing the call! Unfortunately software always fails when the demo comes! Kovan was down during the presentation. If anyone wants to video the demo it is available here:      image1443×887 70 KB
Summary coming soon, but video is up: https://youtu.be/aG9UU-XPULE
Interested to see how Arcoin/Treasuries on DeFi work. Also, it would be cool to see more real world assets onboarded as CEFs.
